60d3ef68-1c04-4e37-b73d-2563ca9e0c84: A frightened creature flees from the source of its fear as best it can. If it's unable to flee, it may fight, but a frightened creature suffers a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}.
484865dd-b2d7-44af-87ba-abc214f5e055: A petrified character has been turned to stone and is considered {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}.
f91434aa-00af-499b-b138-f11c58ed8d6d: A shaken character suffers a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}. Shaken is a less severe state of fear than frightened or panicked.
09a39f49-4845-40c3-8d77-f8bb9cd3e98f: An enemy army has reached you and now attacks.
cd8a5651-f308-4063-8984-757459a7e888: Character is at the {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g}'s door, and escaped a deadly blow only by sheer luck. If their {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} fall below their negative {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score again, then they will truly die. This condition can be removed by visiting a {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healer{/g} at the safe spot or by Greater Restoration.
a1278bf5-44b8-41f9-ad5c-1b1f579b6125:
Charging is a special {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} that allows you to move up to double your normal {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} during the same action.
You must move before your attack, not after. You must move at least 10 feet, directly toward the designated opponent.
You must have a clear path toward the opponent.
After moving, you may make a single {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}. You get a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on the attack {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} and take a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} until the beginning of your next turn.
d9c9c742-d404-4616-8789-98e5eeb6955b:
Charging is a special {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} that allows you to move up to double your normal {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} during the same action.
You must move before your attack, not after. You must move at least 10 feet, directly toward the designated opponent.
You must have a clear path toward the opponent.
After moving, you may make a single {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}. You get a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on the attack {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} and take a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} until the beginning of your next turn.
6ee2a1f8-32eb-430a-98a7-452bddcfe50b:
For each negative level a creature suffers, it takes a cumulative –1 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}Combat Maneuver Defense{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}. In addition, the creature reduces its current and total {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} by 5 for each negative level. The creature is also at a reduced level for the purposes of level-dependent {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} (such as {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g}). Spellcasters do not, however, lose any prepared spells or slots as a result of suffering negative levels. If a creature's negative levels equals its total {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g}, it dies.
Negative levels can be removed through spells like {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}restoration{/g}. A creature whose permanent negative levels equal its Hit Dice cannot be brought back to life through raise dead spell, it can only be done through resurrection spell which removes all negative levels after a dead creature is restored to life.
3ec71e44-e463-4069-9ff2-4376efd3f719: Magic ingredients, the favor of deities, and other magical resources at the crusade's disposal.
b3eed863-cd29-4d19-9dae-8726e74491a7: Money and valuables at the crusade's disposal.
1d4469ae-805f-4b38-8c6e-06a297d87cb8: Resources needed by builders, blacksmiths, and other crafters at the crusade's disposal.
f0d82e7a-7e51-4b2e-93fe-6077f9bbbe9b: The character suffers a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}.
15e2d847-8919-4b61-9631-ce8ea2fe2581: The distortion from storm grants the subject concealment (20% miss chance).
19931ad9-b1f8-4cea-8fa7-a2ff79dd8ad5: The distortion from storm grants the subject concealment (50% miss chance).
772d7116-b1b6-4709-9d82-fe1c8c40d4c3: The enemy fort blocks the way
a8c5a818-6a63-483d-9221-de7487f46b04: The fort is besieged by an enemy.
90c3aa59-f46d-424c-8eaa-0c07711a944b: The fort {0} is besieged by an enemy.
12f4f4e9-9d2e-42cc-8fb2-b519ed1bd0a2: This character's armor is temporarily disabled. It provides no benefits, as if the character wasn't wearing it. The armor itself is not damaged, and will work as usual after the battle ends.
fc324b4a-3f37-4649-8a6f-eacc07e3e0c3: This character's {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} is decreased. It can be restored by resting, or with the help of lesser {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}restoration{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or some more powerful magic. A character whose ability score decreases to 0, dies.
95b14b08-66ed-44a6-b91f-22522f75183d: This character's {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} is decreased. It can only be restored with the help of {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}restoration{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} or some more powerful magic (resting or lesser restoration spell won't help). A character whose ability score decreases to 0, dies.
5f9b2a36-0323-4412-bb42-07bf08fb3f18: This unit is not affected by morale.
271f7241-b1a9-4883-bd95-8950c693635c: When a character is entangled, they can only move at half {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}, they cannot run or charge, and they suffer a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and a –4 penalty to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}. An entangled character who attempts to cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} must pass a {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 15 + spell level), or lose the spell.
e1fd712b-8200-4a16-9592-fd0cb88656d7:
You can attempt to run over your target, trampling them underfoot.
If your {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}maneuver{/g} is successful, you will move through the target's space and deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to it. If your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} exceeds your opponent's {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} by 5 or more, you move through the target's space, deal damage to it, and the target is knocked prone.
If your attempt fails, you halt in the space directly in front of the opponent, or the nearest unoccupied space in front of the target.
